p: The first incidence of SARS-CoV infection was reported on 16 November 2002, in the coastal Guangdong province of southeast China bordering Hong Kong and Macau. This infection spread across 31 countries at a moderate speed. The virus was predicted to originate from bats and civet cats with animal-to-human (zoonotic) and human-to-human modes of transmission, as shown in Table 1. A winter season predilection was also noted in the pattern of this epidemic. After adopting strict public health measures, consisting of quarantine and the lockdown of air traffic, the disease was finally contained by 5 July 2003 [ 22]. During this period, SARS-CoV infected 8422 humans and caused 916 deaths at a CFR of 10.87%. Since then, SARS has phased out, and the outbreak was managed.
